com.vaadin.fluent.api

Interface FluentWindow<THIS extends FluentWindow<THIS>>

  • Type Parameters:
    THIS - Self-referential generic THIS
    All Superinterfaces:
    com.vaadin.event.Action.Container, com.vaadin.event.Action.Notifier, com.vaadin.server.ClientConnector, com.vaadin.ui.Component, com.vaadin.ui.Component.Focusable, com.vaadin.shared.Connector, com.vaadin.event.ContextClickEvent.ContextClickNotifier, com.vaadin.event.FieldEvents.BlurNotifier, com.vaadin.event.FieldEvents.FocusNotifier, FluentAbstractComponent<THIS>, FluentAbstractSingleComponentContainer<THIS>, FluentAction.FluentContainer<THIS>, FluentAction.FluentNotifier<THIS>, FluentClientConnector<THIS>, FluentComponent<THIS>, FluentComponent.FluentFocusable<THIS>, FluentContextClickNotifier<THIS>, FluentFieldEvents.FluentBlurNotifier<THIS>, FluentFieldEvents.FluentFocusNotifier<THIS>, FluentHasComponents<THIS>, FluentHasComponents.FluentComponentAttachDetachNotifier<THIS>, FluentPanel<THIS>, FluentScrollable<THIS>, FluentSingleComponentContainer<THIS>, FluentSizeable<THIS>, com.vaadin.ui.HasComponents, com.vaadin.ui.HasComponents.ComponentAttachDetachNotifier, Iterable<com.vaadin.ui.Component>, com.vaadin.server.Scrollable, Serializable, com.vaadin.ui.SingleComponentContainer, com.vaadin.server.Sizeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FWindow

    public interface FluentWindow<THIS extends FluentWindow<THIS>>
extends FluentPanel<THIS>, FluentFieldEvents.FluentFocusNotifier<THIS>, FluentFieldEvents.FluentBlurNotifier<THIS>
    The base interface for fluent versions of Window
    See Also:
    Window

    • Method Detail

      • withCloseShortcut

        default THIS withCloseShortcut(int keyCode,
                               int... modifiers)
        Adds a close shortcut - pressing this key while holding down all (if any) modifiers specified while this Window is in focus will close the Window.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - the keycode for invoking the shortcut
        modifiers - the (optional) modifiers for invoking the shortcut. Can be set to null to be explicit about not having modifiers.
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.addCloseShortcut(int, int...)

      • withCloseListener

        default THIS withCloseListener(com.vaadin.ui.Window.CloseListener listener)
        Adds a CloseListener to the window. For a window the CloseListener is fired when the user closes it (clicks on the close button). For a browser level window the CloseListener is fired when the browser level window is closed. Note that closing a browser level window does not mean it will be destroyed. Also note that Opera does not send events like all other browsers and therefore the close listener might not be called if Opera is used.

        Since Vaadin 6.5, removing windows using UI.removeWindow(Window) does fire the CloseListener.

        Parameters:
        listener - the CloseListener to add, not null
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.addCloseListener(CloseListener)

      • withResizeListener

        default THIS withResizeListener(com.vaadin.ui.Window.ResizeListener listener)
        Add a resize listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add, not null
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.addResizeListener(ResizeListener)

      • withWindowModeChangeListener

        default THIS withWindowModeChangeListener(com.vaadin.ui.Window.WindowModeChangeListener listener)
        Adds a WindowModeChangeListener to the window. The WindowModeChangeEvent is fired when the user changed the display state by clicking the maximize/restore button or by double clicking on the window header. The event is also fired if the state is changed using Window.setWindowMode(WindowMode).
        Parameters:
        listener - the WindowModeChangeListener to add.
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.addWindowModeChangeListener(WindowModeChangeListener)

      • withWindowOrderChangeListener

        default THIS withWindowOrderChangeListener(com.vaadin.ui.Window.WindowOrderChangeListener listener)
        Adds a WindowOrderChangeListener to the window.

        The WindowOrderChangeEvent is fired when the order position is changed. It can happen when some window (this or other) is brought to front or detached.

        The other way to listen positions of all windows in UI is UI.addWindowOrderUpdateListener(com.vaadin.ui.UI.WindowOrderUpdateListener)

        Parameters:
        listener - the WindowModeChangeListener to add.
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        UI.addWindowOrderUpdateListener(com.vaadin.ui.UI.WindowOrderUpdateListener), Window.addWindowOrderChangeListener(WindowOrderChangeListener)

      • withAssistiveDescription

        default THIS withAssistiveDescription(com.vaadin.ui.Component... components)
        Allows to specify which components contain the description for the window. Text contained in these components will be read by assistive devices when it is opened.
        Parameters:
        components - the components to use as description
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setAssistiveDescription(Component...)

      • withAssistivePostfix

        default THIS withAssistivePostfix(String assistivePostfix)
        Sets the accessibility postfix for the window caption. This postfix is read to assistive device users after the window caption, but not visible on the page.
        Parameters:
        assistivePostfix - String that is placed after the window caption
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setAssistivePostfix(String)

      • withAssistivePrefix

        default THIS withAssistivePrefix(String prefix)
        Sets the accessibility prefix for the window caption. This prefix is read to assistive device users before the window caption, but not visible on the page.
        Parameters:
        prefix - String that is placed before the window caption
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setAssistivePrefix(String)

      • withAssistiveRole

        default THIS withAssistiveRole(com.vaadin.shared.ui.window.WindowRole role)
        Sets the WAI-ARIA role the window. This role defines how an assistive device handles a window. Available roles are alertdialog and dialog (@see Roles Model). The default role is dialog.
        Parameters:
        role - WAI-ARIA role to set for the window
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setAssistiveRole(WindowRole)

      • withClosable

        default THIS withClosable(boolean closable)
        Sets the closable status for the window. If a window is closable it typically shows an X in the upper right corner. Clicking on the X sends a close event to the server. Setting closable to false will remove the X from the window and prevent the user from closing the window.
        Parameters:
        closable - determines if the window can be closed by the user.
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setClosable(boolean)

      • withDraggable

        default THIS withDraggable(boolean draggable)
        Enables or disables that a window can be dragged (moved) by the user. By default a window is draggable.
        Parameters:
        draggable - true if the window can be dragged by the user
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setDraggable(boolean)

      • withModal

        default THIS withModal(boolean modal)
        Sets window modality. When a modal window is open, components outside that window cannot be accessed.

        Keyboard navigation is restricted by blocking the tab key at the top and bottom of the window by activating the tab stop function internally.

        Parameters:
        modal - true if modality is to be turned on
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setDraggable(boolean)

      • withPosition

        default THIS withPosition(int x,
                          int y)
        Sets the position of the window on the screen using withPositionX(int) and withPositionY(int)
        Parameters:
        x - The new x coordinate for the window
        y - The new y coordinate for the window
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setPosition(int, int)

      • withPositionX

        default THIS withPositionX(int positionX)
        Sets the distance of Window left border in pixels from left border of the containing (main window). Has effect only if in WindowMode.NORMAL mode.
        Parameters:
        positionX - the Distance of Window left border in pixels from left border of the containing (main window). or -1 if unspecified.
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setPositionX(int)

      • withPositionY

        default THIS withPositionY(int positionY)
        Sets the distance of Window top border in pixels from top border of the containing (main window). Has effect only if in WindowMode.NORMAL mode.
        Parameters:
        positionY - the Distance of Window top border in pixels from top border of the containing (main window). or -1 if unspecified
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setPositionY(int)

      • withResizable

        default THIS withResizable(boolean resizable)
        Sets window resizable.
        Parameters:
        resizable - true if resizability is to be turned on
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setResizable(boolean)

      • withResizeLazy

        default THIS withResizeLazy(boolean resizeLazy)
        Should resize operations be lazy, i.e. should there be a delay before layout sizes are recalculated. Speeds up resize operations in slow UIs with the penalty of slightly decreased usability. Note, some browser send false resize events for the browser window and are therefore always lazy.
        Parameters:
        resizeLazy - true to use a delay before recalculating sizes, false to calculate immediately.
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setResizeLazy(boolean)

      • withTabStopBottomAssistiveText

        default THIS withTabStopBottomAssistiveText(String bottomMessage)
        Sets the message that is provided to users of assistive devices when the user reaches the bottom of the window when leaving a window with the tab key is prevented.

        This message is not visible on the screen.

        Parameters:
        bottomMessage - String provided when the user navigates with the Tab key to the bottom of the window
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setTabStopBottomAssistiveText(String)

      • withTabStopEnabled

        default THIS withTabStopEnabled(boolean tabStop)
        Set if it should be prevented to set the focus to a component outside a non-modal window with the tab key.

        This is meant to help users of assistive devices to not leaving the window unintentionally.

        For modal windows, this function is activated automatically, while preserving the stored value of tabStop.

        Parameters:
        tabStop - true to keep the focus inside the window when reaching the top or bottom, false (default) to allow leaving the window
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setTabStopEnabled(boolean)

      • withTabStopTopAssistiveText

        default THIS withTabStopTopAssistiveText(String topMessage)
        Sets the message that is provided to users of assistive devices when the user reaches the top of the window when leaving a window with the tab key is prevented.

        This message is not visible on the screen.

        Parameters:
        topMessage - String provided when the user navigates with Shift-Tab keys to the top of the window
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        Window.setTabStopTopAssistiveText(String)

      • withWindowMode

        default THIS withWindowMode(com.vaadin.shared.ui.window.WindowMode windowMode)
        Sets the mode for the window.
        Parameters:
        windowMode - The new mode
        Returns:
        this for method chaining
        See Also:
        WindowMode, Window.setWindowMode(WindowMode)
